Art From Tiny Beads Studio Museum in Harlem, 144 West 125th Street; (212) 864-4500, and the Museum for African Art, 593 Broadway (near Houston Street); (212) 966-1313.

''Beads, Body and Soul: Art and Light in the Yoruba Universe,'' a joint exhibition of 150 beaded costumes, headdresses, thrones, banners, sculpture and paintings, opens on Wednesday. The exhibition will close at the Museum for African Art on Aug. 27 and at the Studio Museum on Sept. 17. The show, which will include historic and contemporary works, will explore the use of color, pattern and shape in Yoruba beaded art. It will be open at the Museum for African Art Tuesday through Friday, 10:30 a.m. to 5:30 p.m.; Saturday and Sunday, noon to 6 p.m. Admission is $5; students, children under 12 and those 65 and older, $2.50.

The hours at the Studio Museum in Harlem are Wednesday and Thursday, noon to 6 p.m.; Friday, noon to 8 p.m.; Saturday and Sunday, 10 a.m. to 6 p.m. Admission to the Studio Museum is by donation of $5; students and those 65 and older, $3; children under 12, $1.
A shuttle bus will operate between the two museums on Saturdays (except for July 1). A shuttle schedule is available by calling.
Museum Benefit Merchant's House Museum, 29 East Fourth Street; (212) 777-1089.

A garden party, with an auction of Empire-style furniture, botanical prints and Tiffany jewelry, will take place next Thursday, from 6:30 to 9 p.m. Proceeds from tickets, $85 and $150, or $65 for those 35 and younger, will benefit the museum, a 19th-century Greek Revival home.
